record.dc:title: 19JO14, 15JO14, Johnson County, Kentucky. Mayo. Feature #13.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Late Prehistoric Fort Ancient Sites in Kentucky
record.wpa:narrative: Feature #13. A fireplace with burned rock, animal bone, and pottery. An oval shaped fireplace containing bones of deer, bear, fowl. Material uncovered for Photo #19 was 0.60 ft. deep. However other material was below in the ash for a depth of 0.80 ft. May have represented a pit for roasting purposes as evidenced by material found in it. Bottom of pit was a total depth of 1.40 ft. from surface at stk. 100-0.
record.wpa:comments: More information, including diagram, available at institution.
